workPosts.title: Sellers
workPosts.body: Ecommerce B2C and B2B for Riqra 🎉, offered as a SaaS solution for different LATAM countries. Some clients in production are: **[IL Pastificio](//www.ilpastificio.com/)**, **[Alicorp](//alicorp.riqra.com/)**, **[Montana](//compraonline.corpmontana.com)**, **[Quimica Suiza](//qmarket.riqra.com)**, **[Nestle](//sagatrans.riqra.com/)** and **[many others](//directorio.riqra.com)**. (viewed on Sep-2019)

workPosts.title: Sellers API
workPosts.body: API for Riqra, exposed mainly as a GraphQL❤️ solution. Encapsulate bussiness logic for any generic ecommerce and also specific features for some vendors. Large codebase well-tested by hundred of integration tests 💪. Use background-workers for expensive and critial operations 💯.

workPosts.title: Directory
workPosts.body: Simple and useful monolithic application for Riqra to discover and contact vendors, taking advance of Algolia Instant Search 🔍. RESTful and NextJS solution first-time use of Truck. 🙌

workPosts.title: Truck
workPosts.body: UI Components Library for Riqra 💅, used by all the frontend internal projects. Following the internal design system 👨‍🎨. Focused in CSS-in-JS.

workPosts.title: This Site
workPosts.body: Not a blog, I'm not a blogger 🙃. Just a side project to enjoy music while I code, and also to show things I've worked ✌️.

workPosts.title: ZEIT Toast Clone
workPosts.body: A front-end challenge required by myself 😅, I worked with animation effects powered by the awesome spring library. 😍 **[Here the original](//zeit.co/design/toast)**.

workPosts.title: Hashing with PBKDF2
workPosts.body: Serverless application to use **[the pbkdf2 algorithm](//en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PBKDF2)** 👽 and a sort of playground to hash any text like account safe passwords. **[My λ function is right here](//github.com/rqbazan/hashing-with-pbkdf2/blob/master/pages/api/index.js)** ℹ️.

workPosts.title: FeatFlag
workPosts.body: A small and modern React library to use **[the feature toggling principle](//martinfowler.com/articles/feature-toggles.html)** 🤩, using the power of contexts. I've used this technical principle for some of my bigger projects.
